cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles SE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn north and northeast, hugging the Texas coast before moving across Louisiana and into Mississippi/Alabama late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / central Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, Texas (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, Texas to Morgan City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central & upper Texas coast, western Louisiana, extending eastward to Ocean Springs, Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts near 25–30 mph possible late Thursday into Friday; sustained gale-force winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–2 ft possible along the Mississippi coast; surge greater than 3 ft not expected at Pascagoula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain expected Thu–Fri with localized higher totals, posing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands as the system moves across Mississippi.
